name: pascal
text: Or, as Nice Pete likes to call them, "Tuesdays".

name: equinn2006
text: For the first "fact" I like to hear the voice of Dwight from The Office, slowly becoming more and more deranged until the screaming and fist-shaking.

name: pigs
text: You deserve a chubby for the office reference.

name: singtralala
text: A comment left by singtralala was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Vondicus, Ariamaki, Boyd, ASaltySalute4, TheGreatestCape)

name: the_stoned_one
text: Dwight from the office would probably be the best casting for Nice Pete if anyone was deranged enough to try and make a live version of Achewood.

name: mangtastic
text: They have the same head-shape!  It could work.

name: saint
text: That's what she said?

name: anzio
text: Man, making a live action version would be awful. I'd rather just pay Chris 100 grand to stop doing whatever he's doing and co-direct an animated movie with a director of competence... maybe Terry Gilliam?

name: tekende
text: Chris Onstad and Terry Gilliam working together on a project? It would never, ever, ever be finished.

name: anzio
text: This is true.

name: gournal
text: "Security in this office park is a joke. Last year, I came to work with my spud gun in a duffel bag. I sat at my desk all day with a rifle that shoots potatoes at sixty pounds per square inch. Can you imagine if I was deranged?? "

name: woof
text: alt text: Nothing a good voice coach and a lobotomy couldn't help with

name: djwhiterabbit
text: nice pete has since been declared the winner of a basketball game against the man on the other end of the phone.

name: spinynorman
text:
God made psychopaths so we would be polite to one another. That dude you cut off on the highway could follow you home. The last thing you would see would be him straddling you with handfuls of your intestines, weeping and asking you, "What are these? Were you trying to fool me? What are these?"

If only you had been considerate.

name: nigelchaos
text:
Wow...
A winner is you.

name: spinynorman
text: Haha, thanks, it's even creepier with the new avatar

name: terebikun
text: Actually it's just more logical.  If you had an avatar of, say, Encyclopedia Brown looking pedantic, that might be creepier.

name: spinynorman
text: Man, when doesn't Encyclopedia Brown look Pedantic? Fuck that guy.

name: terebikun
text: True.  Maybe he's drooling a little at the mouth too.  I always imagine him as such a mouth-breather.  Honestly, where is he going to go in life?  He's lived out his 15 minutes of fame back in middle school or whenever those books happened.  Years down the road he'll be the barista wishing he hadn't dropped out of detective school and harassing people who are trying to finish their crossword puzzle without help.

name: nigelchaos
text: Where's Dr. Manflesh with an Encyclopedia Brown fanfic when you need him?!

name: boredom_man
text: I'm pretty sure William H. Macy played him in Magnolia

name: terebikun
text: This is the best possible answer

name: relaxing
text: Who are you, Bugs Meany?

name: johnnybaverage
text: Fuck you, Encyclopedia Brown! SCREW you!

name: dissembly
text: It helps that I imagine everything you say in Stephen Fry's voice and cadence.

name: stormagnet
text: ...though I would peg Nice Pete as a bit more of a schizophrenic.

name: soticoto
text:
You get insane chubbies for being gory.
I get insane lames for being gory (and other things).

... It probably falls halfway between avatar and reputation, but it still strikes me as unjust.
Not a complaint about your little story, mind you. I enjoyed that. ^_^

name: fuzzyrobot
text: Oh my God I lamed your post instead of chubbying it oh my God what did I doooo

name: nonorganon
text: I can't really imagine the effects that would have on the voice.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: Epilogue: the man on the other line was mysteriously kidnapped the next day. His family has received one cubic inch of his body in the mail once a week for the past 2 1/2 years.

name: epicurus
text: Does this work out to a very large person? Let's Sciencize it, yeah!

name: scraggg
text: Well, that's about 130 cubic inches (52 weeks in a year, 52   52   26 = 130), or, roughly 9 cups of person.

name: tekende
text: Of course, the recommended serving size of person is about one-and-a-half cups.

name: i_love_kate
text: Per person?

name: direhaggis
text: I praise your avatar being the 	Lift Your Skinny Fists Like Antennas to Heaven album cover. Chubbied.

name: ford
text: this does not mean he's a large person, but I'm sure pete is far from finished.

name: riazm
text: Nice Pete is actually calling this number at 6am.

name: bourbonsamurai
text: This one feels like Onstad came up with the last line and then spent awhile thinking how the heck he could work it into a script.

name: spinynorman
text:
It probably wasn't that hard - with a lot of these characters, especially Pete, they're sort of like broken fire hydrants spraying awesome non-sequiturs all over the damn place.

Laughing, giggling children dancing in the non-sequiturs is both optional and bizarre.

name: aelindil
text: Your similes and metaphors are the best similes and metaphors.

name: tekende
text: He's like a shark. He's just gotta...keep making metaphors.

name: spicyponyhead
text: "Like a shark" is a simile.

name: tekende
text: My post was a Penny Arcade reference.

name: spicyponyhead
text: Then please lame me, for I cannot lame myself (as I just found out when I tried to do so)!

name: tekende
text: I have no lames, but I would not lame you for that anyway.

name: spicyponyhead
text: HUUUUUUUUUUGS!

name: waldo913
text: Is that the Fist of Conviction that I see Nice Pete sporting there in p7? I think it is...

name: professorhazard
text:
Man, that's crazy talk! That text ain't big enough to be analagous to Sam Kinison's method of speech!

Sheesh, the imagination on this kid!

name: professorhazard
text: It starts out innocuously enough. You're commenting. You're having a good time. And then you realize that you've misspelled "analogous"... and that there's no way to ever set that right.

name: direhaggis
text: I spelled grammar as grammer once. A bald old man ripped me a new one. The little red line underneath words was supposed to tell me. I guess the beer was louder.

name: mattylite
text: I lost a spelling bee that way.  I felt really stupid afterwards.  We should start a club.

name: hateandwar
text: I know I've lost more than one spelling bee because my beer was too loud. I've since switched to whiskey in a flask.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Wednesday Blogs

Molly: Happy Holidays!

name: i_love_kate
text: Pat's lawyer called Siccio and Molly's employer called Del Vecchio going insane in very similar ways is sort of disquieting for me in a way that I can only really compare to certain Lovecraft short stories.

name: stewieisgod13
text:
No! This isn't Tim from accounting!
So great.

name: tekende
text: Every time I read this strip something different in it makes me laugh. Today it was "huge rails of coke."

name: aliiis
text: Yeah, I love strips like that. I think in this one the first time I was all about Pete's hand gestures in the second row. Today it's more his eyes-closed 'ahem' in panel 4. Thank you for being the most recent comment and making me see this wonderful strip and giggle again.

name: mtrott
text: Fact: a good voice coach and a lobotomy are really all one needs to succeed in life

name: scifigrl47
text: When he holds a phone to where a human ear should be, his cat ears look more like devil horns than it just and right.  but holy heavens, cat's got good hearing if he can hear that phone through his SKULL.

name: excusemesenator
text: I'm sorry but it is such a trope to have a character talk about insert-name-here "from accounting"
